columns.text: In this problem, we will determine whether the company should upgrade their manufacturing capabilities or pay out dividends in order to increase the value of the firm in the long run.

The numerator $\text{E}_1(1-\text{b})$ refers to the dividends paid out by the firm based on their earnings. The earnings, dividends, and price of the company's stock are all proportional this means that even if the earnings are increased, the dividend payout will also increase.

This means that the price of the company's stock will remain the same even if a higher dividend payout is done by the company.

Therefore, in order to increase the value of the company both long- and short-term, it is better to reinvest their profits to upgrade their manufacturing capability since this type of project is a positive net present value project which means it will increase the company's earning capability and thus increase the company's stock price.

textbook.authors: Bradford D. Jordan, Randolph W. Westerfield, Stephen A. Ross
textbook.title: Fundamentals of Corporate Finance
